links.title: Apple Q2 Earnings: 3 Things Investors Should Watch For
links.description: Apple, Inc. AAPL is expected to report its fiscal second-quarter earnings on April 28 after the market close. One analyst has listed three important factors Apple investors should be watching in the Apple earnings report. The Analyst: Bank of America analyst Wamsi Mohan reiterated his Buy rating and $215 price target for Apple.

body: $MU there’s a point to where most stocks are at concrete institutional bottom. and it really doesn’t matter what retail does. I call it the stupid people period. it’s too late to sell, time to buy. rally is coming, 1000 point drops are stupid people things, if you think 2-3-4 more 1000 point drops are in the cards, you need to pull your head out of your ass and study volumes and turn over rates. I like GM and MU over the next month. GM will have a weak ER, but their turnover rate and guidance will line up. $GM $AAPL $AMD

body: $AAPL everyone blaming fed and russia, giving free card to retail who pumped stocks way beyond their value, and new investors pumping tech and chips to prices based on how big they think the market will be in 2030 and beyond. You can't price 2030 in right now then be surprised stocks go down when there's a little turbulence. Retail just as much at fault. Apple isn't a $180/share company. They're solid, but not at that price. NVDA didn't belong over 300. Go to the coke page, or Johnson and Johnson to see the difference in boards. No one complaining there cause noob investors didn't buy "boring" stocks. I dont own any of the stocks I listed. Just stating facts. Do love trading apple options though

links.title: Court orders Apple to pay buyer for missing iPhone charger | Digital Trends
links.description: A regional court in Brazil has ordered Apple to compensate an iPhone buyer following a complaint about not getting a charger in the retail box. As per the court's ruling, Apple will have to pay a sum of 5,000 Brazilian real, which translates to approximately $1,080 based on the current conversion rates, to the affected iPhone buyer.
